items.title: Turbo-charged incremental bundling au Rust
items.content:
#â€‹612 â€” October 28, 2022

Read on the Web
Together withÂ 

JavaScript Weekly

Turbopack: A Rust-Based 'Successor' to Webpack â€” With over 3 billion downloads, webpack is currently the undisputed champion of the bundlers (though Vite has been rapidly advancing upon it). Vercel found it too slow so has funded work on Turbopack, powered by Rust (a synonym for â€˜fasterâ€™ in some circles nowadays.. ğŸ˜) It's a project to keep an eye on (especially if you're a Next.js user) and boasts significant performance boosts over webpack and even Vite, but there are some limitations to take into account:

  • It's arguable if it's a "successor" to webpack, as Turbopack can't do much of what Webpack can yet, and while they share a creator, webpack is an active project with maintainers of its own.
  • It's very connected to React and Next.js 13 (also released this week â€“ more on that next) â€“ Vue and Svelte support is to follow.
  • The similarly Rust-powered SWC is used to transpile JS/TS.
  • Vite's Evan You ğŸ¦ casts some doubt on the perf differenceÂ claims. He also has ğŸ¦ a thread with his thoughts on TurbopackÂ generally.
  • In short, unless you are living on the Next.js edge, stick with webpack or Vite for now.

Koppers and Palmer (Vercel)

Implement JavaScript Developer Solutions for Every Project â€” Get dependency-free, fast, flexible, true JavaScript components that enable you to build basic websites, full enterprise applications, Excel-like spreadsheet tools, and reports for your organization. Empower your JavaScript developersÂ today.

GrapeCity sponsor

Node 18 Becomes Active LTS with v18.12.0 â€” Formerly a â€˜currentâ€™ release getting all the newest features, version 18 is now the active â€˜Long Term Supportâ€™ release and will remain so until October 2023. Its codename is Hydrogen â€“ quite fitting as the most abundant element in theÂ universe.

Ruy Adorno and Rafael Gonzaga

If you're using an older LTS version and are wondering what Node 18 has to offer, Marian Villa presents 11 Features in Node.js 18 you need to try, including the fetch API, --watch, and the native Node test runner.

IN BRIEF:

  • The SQLite project now has official WASM/JS documentation relating to SQLite's presence in WebAssembly and browser contexts. sql.js has long been the go-to project in this space, but things are heating up.

  • CodePen is a perfect place to play with Preact (the smaller alternative to React) â€“ and Chris Coyier explains how.

  • Christian Heilmann reminds us that JSON.stringify can create nicely formatted, filtered, multi-line output strings.

Next.js 13 Unveiled at Next.js Conf â€” Next.js Conf 22 took place earlier this week and as well as Turborepo (above), Vercel unveiled the latest version of the site framework that has become 'inextricably linked' to React. It gains:

  • Support for an app/ directory to improve routing, layouts, and Server Components support â€“ can coexist with existing approaches.
  • A new image component with on-demand optimization and the ability to display images without layout shift.
  • A brand new font system.

Vercel

"Next.js is the framework for the web the way k8s is the framework for infrastructure" â€“ Kelsey Hightower at Next.js Conf.

JetBrains JavaScript Day 2022: An Event You Wonâ€™t Want toÂ Miss â€” Join JetBrains JavaScript Day 2022 to catch up on the latest trends and connect with other like-mindedÂ professionals.

JetBrains sponsor

RELEASES:

  • Babel 7.20.0
    â†³ The popular transpiler now supports TypeScript 4.9 and Deno as a compilation target.

  • Handsontable 12.2 â€“ Popular spreadsheet-y data grid.

  • Deno 1.27 â€“ JS server-side runtime that isn't Node. (Or Bun.)

  • Qwik 0.12 â€“ HTML-first framework.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Which Serverless Edge Platform Has the Fastest Git Deployments? â€” The team behind Deno have tested some popular serverless edge computing providers (including their own Deno Deploy) to see which has the fastest git deploymentÂ time. As always with benchmarks, read the results with a cynical eye and repeat forÂ yourself.

Andy Jiang (Deno)

How We Improved React Loading Times by 70% with Next.js â€” By replacing Create React App with Next.js, business planning platform Causal significantly improved their user experience by reducing load times. How? Well, just a little SSR can get you a longÂ way.

Causal Engineers

How to Build a Blog with Fresh and Deno â€” In other Deno news, if youâ€™ve felt like giving Deno a go for something but been unsure as to what, how about spinning up a simple blog atop the Fresh Web framework? Then deploy it really quickly to Deno Deploy ;-)

Andy Jiang (Deno)

The Fastest Way to Learn JavaScript / TypeScript â€” With 2M+ downloads world-wide, Quokka.js is the #1 tool for exploring and testing JavaScript/TypeScript without leaving yourÂ editor.

Wallaby.js sponsor

How to Write Your First Unit Test in JavaScript â€” If youâ€™re a prolific tester, scroll on. If not, this is a very lightÂ primer.

Chip Verek

â–¶Â Â A Next.js Crash Course â€” There are a lot of such videos, but this is a well recorded and up to date one so it might help you get the lay of the Next.js land (which seems to be all the rage this week in particular) if youâ€™re just starting out with it. (2 hours 30Â minutes)

Anson Foong

Detect a System Theme Preference Change from JS â€” window.matchMedia and addEventListener to theÂ rescue.

David Walsh

Advancements in Angular 14.2's Router
Andrew Scott

Using Cloudinary's Image APIs from Alpine.js
Raymond Camden

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

npoint: Simple JSON Storage Bins with Schema Validation â€” You can use this as a lightweight backend as you prototype an app/site or play with a new library. You can even let other people make changes to the data, if youÂ wish.

Alex Zirbel

Satori: Convert HTML and CSS to SVG â€” React and JSX are the preferred route in to this, but itâ€™ll work withoutÂ those. It powers Vercel's new 'social card' image generation feature.

Vercel

Donâ€™t DIY Your Notifications: Send SMS, Email, and Push withÂ OneÂ Call

Courier.com sponsor

Downshift 7.0: Primitives to Build Accessible ReactÂ Components â€” You get hooks that provide the stateful logic needed to create autocomplete, combo-box and â€˜selectâ€™ dropdown components which you can then lean on for WAI-ARIA compliantÂ goodness.

PayPal

ğŸ‰ Â Canvas Confetti: An On-Demand Confetti Shower â€” Ready to let off some fireworks in your browser? Do it in style with confetti. Plenty of demos to check out. GitHubÂ repo.

Kiril Vatev

  • NPKILL 0.9
    â†³ Lists node_modules directories and lets you clean them up.

  • Wild Wild Path 3.3
    â†³ Object property paths with wildcards and regexps.

  • capture-website 3.2
    â†³ Capture screenshots of websites with Puppeteer.

  • Mongoose 6.7
    â†³ MongoDB object modeling library for Node.js.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Become a Senior JS/TS Developer for a Leading Rich Text Editor â€” Take the next step in your career and help us migrate CKEditor 5 to TypeScript. Develop the software used by millions of usersÂ ğŸŒ
CKEditor

Software Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Stickermule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

Software Engineer (Security) â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're looking for more exceptional engineers to join our SecurityÂ team.
Sticker Mule

ğŸ‘» And just in time for Halloween..

Creepyface: Makes Images of Faces 'Follow' the Pointer â€” This is an effect weâ€™ve seen mostly on â€˜about usâ€™ pages where faces of team members follow your pointer around. If you want to recreate that, here you go.. and in a timely Halloween edition too. (React user? There's a component forÂ that.)

Alejandro TardÃ­n

items.title: ğŸªœ Decorating with Dr. Axel
items.content:
#â€‹611 â€” October 21, 2022

Read on the Web
Together withÂ 

JavaScript Weekly

Metaprogramming with the 2022-03 Decorators API â€” If youâ€™re a Python developer, youâ€™ll be miles ahead on this idea. If not, decorators provide a way to manipulate classes, fields, methods, and accessors at define time to give them extra, amended, or wrapped functionality or behavior. The proposal is at stage 3 at TC39, is supported by Babel, and will soon be supported by TypeScript, so why not get up to speed with Dr. R.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Node.js 19 (Current) Released â€” We did a big feature in yesterdayâ€™s Node Weekly, but in short, this is the new, edgiest 'Current' non-LTS Node.js release which gains a Nodemon-esque --watch mode, HTTP KeepAlive on by default, stable WebCrypto API, and a bump to V8 10.7. Node 18 goes Active LTS nextÂ week.

The Node.js Project

Your Source for Candid Chats on Product, Business & Leadership â€” If youâ€™re looking for insights on how to get to a successful product launch, why being vulnerable can help make you a better leader, or how to ship software with realistic deadlines, the Postlight Podcast is forÂ you.

The Postlight Podcast sponsor

A Real World React to htmx Migration Story â€” htmx is a library that â€˜turbo chargesâ€™ HTML by letting you use numerous JS and Web API features via custom HTML attributes. Here a Python-based team shows how it worked better for them than a more common ReactÂ approach.

David Guillot

p5.js 1.5: Creative JS Coding, Now with Animated GIF Exporting â€” p5 is hard to define â€“ itâ€™s like Processing but for JavaScript, and it lets you create creative, visual experiences in the browser. Examples? Why, of course. v1.5 is a significant release as you can now easily save GIFs of your creations which leads to fantastic tweets like this. Basically if you want to generate cool animated GIFs using JavaScript, this should be your first port ofÂ call.

Qianqian Ye and Contributors

IN BRIEF:

  • One of Emotion's contributors kicked off a few lunchtime conversations by explaining why his team is 'breaking up' with CSS-in-JS. As no-one says but me, what's new is old again.

  • Not been keeping an eye on browser devtool developments? Patrick Brosset has a Halloween-themed 'What's New in DevTools'Â roundup ğŸ‘»

  • The React world is discussing a proposal to add first class support for promises and async/await in client and server components.

  • Two Storybook (the component dev tool) updates: they're baking in first-class Vite support to v7, and they have a newly designed site (it's here.)

  • ğŸ¤ Two developers â–¶ï¸ discuss jQuery's relevance and ask 'is it really soÂ bad?'

ğŸ“… Â Live Event: Visual Workflow Automation, Now with Code â€” No more one-off scripts, CRON jobs, or ETL tasks. Reclaim your time and build automation like aÂ developer.

Retool sponsor

RELEASES:

  • Prisma 4.5 â€“ Modern ORM for Node & TypeScript.
  • Mocha 10.1 â€“ Test framework for Node & browser.
  • SolidJS 1.6.0 â€“ VDOM-less reactive frontend UI library.
  • Ember.js 4.8.0
  • supabase-js v2

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Creating a World-Class Code Playground with Sandpack â€” CodeSandboxâ€™s Sandpack is a toolkit for creating â€˜live code editorâ€™ components. Josh Comeau shows off how to use it to good effect to boost your blog posts, courses, and theÂ like.

Josh W Comeau

Secure JavaScript URL Validation â€” Though conforming to a standard structure, URLs come in all shapes and sizes and you may not want your app to accept URLs that are malformed or otherwise problematic. This post covers some of the considerationsÂ involved.

Mannan Tirmizi (Snyk)

'What if the Team Hates My Functional Code?' â€” I think most folks whoâ€™ve been bitten by the functional programming bug have eventually run into problems when convincing other developers itâ€™s the way to go. James provides some soothingÂ perspective.

James Sinclair

Why Does JSON.parse 'Corrupt' Large Numbers? â€” Jump into your JavaScript console of choice and try JSON.parse('{"count": 9123372036854000123}') .. you might not get the result you expect, and Jos set out to figure out why and how to resolve it â€“ â€˜quite a juicy topicâ€™, heÂ promises.

Jos de Jong

Tutorial: Add SSO & Access Control to Your Node.js App

Userfront sponsor

â–¶Â Â Effortless End-to-End Type-Safety with Phero â€” A ten-minute demonstration of a library providing a type-safe TypeScript-based way to communicate between frontend and backend. GitHubÂ repo.

Jasper Haggenburg

Modern CSS in Angular: Layouts
Emma Twersky

How to Use Google Sheets as a Database from React with Serverless
Paul Scanlon

Building a Chat App with Socket.io and React Native
Nevo David

How to Use storage in Web Extensions
David Walsh

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

route-list: CLI Tool to Display Express/Koa/Hapi/Fastify Routes â€” If youâ€™ve got a Node-based webapp and you want to see all of its endpoints in an elegant way, hereâ€™s anÂ option.

Vladimir Mikulic

TypeRunner: A High-Performance TypeScript Compiler â€” The TypeScript project already has its own compiler (tsc - written in TypeScript itself) but this is an independent C++ (no, not Rust for once!) attempt at making type checking even faster. If youâ€™re asking â€œwhyâ€: they have an answer forÂ that.

Marc J. Schmidt

Strong CAPTCHA: A Secure and Scalable Way to Fight Fraud â€” Learn how to combat CAPTCHA fraud without sacrificing userÂ experience.

Stytch sponsor

Angular Starter: Angular 14 plus Storybook, Transloco, Jest, and More â€” Everything but the kitchenÂ sink?

Wilfried Lucha

  • Peaks.js 2.1
    â†³ BBC component for interacting with audio waveforms.

  • Reveal.js 4.4
    â†³ Write your presentations in HTML. (Demo.)

  • styled-jsx 5.1
    â†³ Full, scoped CSS support for JSX.

  • svg-path-morph
    â†³ Interpolate between SVG path variations.

  • lowdb 4.0 â€“ Simple local JSON database.

  • twgl.js 5.1 â€“ Low-level WebGL helper library.

  • PSD 0.3 â€“ Fast Photoshop/PSD file parser.

  • SVGuitar 2.0 â€“ Create guitar chord charts.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) â€” CKEditor is migrating to TypeScript, will you migrate your talent to the CKEditor team? ğŸ§³ Join us and realize your trueÂ potential.
CKEditor

Doppler - A SecretOps Platform Built by Developers for Developers â€” Dopplerâ€™s looking for Sr. Full-Stack Engineers to help shape the future of security devtools. TypeScript, React, Express, and Go, applyÂ here.
Doppler

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

TypeRunner: A High-Performance TypeScript Compiler â€” The TypeScript project already has its own compiler (tsc - written in TypeScript itself) but this is an independent C++ (no, not Rust for once!) attempt at making type checking even faster. If youâ€™re asking â€œwhyâ€: they have an answer forÂ that.
Marc J. Schmidt 


  
  
Strong CAPTCHA: A Secure and Scalable Way to Fight Fraud â€” Learn how to combat CAPTCHA fraud without sacrificing userÂ experience.
Stytch sponsor


  
  
Angular Starter: Angular 14 plus Storybook, Transloco, Jest, and More â€” Everything but the kitchenÂ sink?
Wilfried Lucha 




Peaks.js 2.1
Reveal.js 4.4
Demo.)
styled-jsx 5.1
svg-path-morph
lowdb 4.0 â€“ Simple local JSON database.
twgl.js 5.1 â€“ Low-level WebGL helper library.
PSD 0.3 â€“ Fast Photoshop/PSD file parser.
SVGuitar 2.0 â€“ Create guitar chord charts.








ğŸ’» Jobs





  
Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) â€” CKEditor is migrating to TypeScript, will you migrate your talent to the CKEditor team? ğŸ§³ Join us and realize your trueÂ potential.
  
CKEditor 
  


  
Doppler - A SecretOps Platform Built by Developers for Developers â€” Dopplerâ€™s looking for Sr. Full-Stack Engineers to help shape the future of security devtools. TypeScript, React, Express, and Go, applyÂ here.
  
Doppler 
  


  
Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
  
Hired

items.title: Node to keep an eye on your code
items.content:
#â€‹610 â€” October 14, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web
Together withÂ 

JavaScript Weekly

Intl Explorer: A Way to Learn and Experiment with the ECMAScript Internationalization API â€” Supported by all major browsers, the Intl object provides access to the ECMAScript Internationalization API, a suite of functions for language sensitive string comparison, number formatting, and more. This site provides an interactive way to learn about how itÂ operates.

Jesper Orb

â–¶Â Â Creating Your Own JavaScript Runtime with V8 â€” Want to join the pantheon of developers famed and esteemed for creating things like Node, Deno, and Bun by creating a JS runtime of your own? Erick takes us deep into the main moving parts and shows us how to tie them together for ourselves. While you might not build the next Deno or Bun for yourself, thereâ€™s a lot to learn about JS runtimesÂ here.

Erick Wendel

ğŸ–Š If you prefer a written alternative, Deno's Bartek IwaÅ„czuk has tackled this topic before (at a higher level) in "Roll your own JavaScript runtime."

Event Driven Node.js Hackathon: +$3k in PrizeÂ Value â€” There are still 14 days left, and more than enough time to still submit a project that could win. Courier Hacks: Open Source is holding a contest to see who can build a casual encrypted messaging app. Get started now and you could be theÂ winner.

Courier.com sponsor

Node v18.11.0 (Current) Released; Gains 'Watch Mode' â€” Nodeâ€™s latest release doesnâ€™t gain a lot, but does gain an experimental --watch feature that automatically restarts the running process when imported files are changed (reminiscent of nodemon) â€“ this feature was discussed at length recently.

Danielle Adams (Node.js Project)

Lerna Reborn: Whatâ€™s New in Version 6? â€” Far from being obsolete or deprecated, the Lerna monorepo-oriented JavaScript build system is taking big strides forward under Nrwlâ€™s stewardship. v6 gains a lot of speed with efficient task scheduling and caching by default, a VS Code extension, Prettier support, and more. GitHubÂ repo.

Juri Strumpflohner

IN BRIEF:

  • Upstart JavaScriptCore-based runtime Bun has a new version out that boasts a big boost in HTTP server performance as well as zero-downtime hot reloading. It's fun seeing the project come along!

  • ğŸ’„ javascript.makeup is a cute new online JavaScript 'playground' that keeps itÂ minimal. (Alternatives: JSBin, JSFiddle)

  • Storybook 7.0 will have first class support for Vite.

  • ğŸ“Š The results from the first ever State of GraphQL developer survey are out.

RELEASES:

  • Volar 1.0 â€“ Official IDE tooling support for Vue.js.

  • Ant Design 5.0 Alpha â€“ Popular React UI library.

  • Rollup 3.1 â€“ The ES module bundler.

  • RxDB 13.5 â€“ Offline-first, reactive database for JS apps.

  • Qwik 0.11 â€“ 'No hydration', HTML-first framework.

  • Jest 29.2 & Cypress 10.10 â€“ Testing frameworks.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

The Future of Rendering in React â€” This kicks off with a review of current patterns (CSR/SSR) and then moves on to some of the new rendering patterns such as streaming SSR and server components. This was also the basis of a recent talk at ReactÂ Bangalore.

Prateek Surana

Choosing the Best Node.js Docker Image â€” If you feel tempted to just throw FROM node into your Dockerfile, think again â€“ there are other options toÂ consider.

Liran Tal (Snyk)

Why We Use Babylon.js Instead of Three.js in 2022 â€” The Blender addon, support from Microsoft, and Babylonâ€™s rather advanced inspector tooling all won Gordonâ€™s teamÂ over.

Gordon Hempton

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, now with support forÂ Vitest.

Wallaby.js sponsor

How I Created a GameBoy-Style Game in 13KB â€” A developer explains his js13KGames 2022 entry (we linked to the winners lastÂ week).

Kacper Kula

â–¶Â Â Full Stack for Front-End Developers: Build Your First AWS Amplify and React App â€” Ali Spittel leads dev advocacy at AWS Amplify and has released the first in a series of free courses on end-to-end development with the Amplify platform. Check out the â–¶ï¸ briefÂ trailer.

Ali Spittel (AWS Amplify)

How to Build SVG Line Charts with React, SSR and Tailwind CSS â€” How to roll your own SVG based line charts in a server-side rendered React app based around either Next.js orÂ Gatsby.

Paul Scanlon

A Semantic HTML Trick for React Components
Queen Raae

Using TypeScript Type Guards
Robin Wieruch

How Wix Uses Threading in Node.js Apps to Cut Its Kubernetes Pod Costs
Jessica Wachtel (The New Stack)

How Using Default Exports Makes JavaScript Harder to Read
Tomasz CichociÅ„ski

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Javet 2.0.0: Embed Node and V8 in Java Apps â€” Lets you spin up V8 interpreters or full Node.js runtimes within JVM-based apps. Thereâ€™s a slide presentation to sell you on the idea and demonstrate how the integration works. The name Javet comes from 'Java, V, and Eight'.

Sam Cao

Knip: Find Unused Files, Dependencies and Exports in TypeScriptÂ Projects â€” Knip is Dutch for â€œcutâ€ which is appropriate for a tool that trims away things not being used in your project. To compare it to similar existing tools, thereâ€™s this handyÂ chart.

Lars Kappert

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Editly 0.14.0: Declarative Command Line Video Editing â€” Brings Node and FFmpeg together to let you more programatically edit and construct videos instead of wrangling with arcane ffmpeg command lineÂ options.

Mikael Finstad

Sortable: Create and Reorder Lists with Drag-and-Drop â€” Supporting all modern browsers and touch devices, this library handles list-to-list dragging with auto scrolling, CSS animations, multi-drag support, and more. Lots ofÂ demos.

SortableJS

React Table Library: The 'Almost Headless' Table Library â€” Has an interesting showcase site showing off what you can do with it. Itâ€™s happy both on the client and server-side and supports TypeScriptÂ too.

Robin Wieruch

Offline Support for React Native Is Here! Try V5 of Stream's Chat SDK

Stream sponsor

melonJS 14.0: A Lightweight 2D Game Engine â€” Itâ€™s over a decade old, but still going strong. While itâ€™s 2D, itâ€™ll use WebGL for performance (if available). Also offers Web Audio API support, polygon based collision detection, input device support, and more. Hereâ€™s an exampleÂ game.

melonJS Team

React Modern Audio Player: An Audio Player with Waveform Visualization â€” See it in actionÂ here.

âš¡ï¸ OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

  • SlickGrid 3.0
    â†³ Fast JavaScript grid/spreadsheet control. (Demos.)

  • Faker 7.6 â€“ Fake data generation library.

  • React Tooltip 4.4 â€“ Bet you can guess what it does.

  • Mineflayer 4.5 â€“ Build Minecraft bots in JS.

  • CsvToMarkdownTable 1.2 â€“ Turn CSV into Markdown tables.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Full-Stack Engineer (NYC / Remote) â€” 100M+ devices, 100B+ API calls. Radar is looking for Product Engineers to build geospatial devÂ tools.
Radar

Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) â€” CKEditor is migrating to TypeScript, will you migrate your talent to the CKEditor team? ğŸ§³ Join us and realize your trueÂ potential.
CKEditor

Software Engineer (Security) â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're looking for more exceptional engineers to join our SecurityÂ team.
Sticker Mule

Attend Our October 20th 2022 State of Tech Salaries Panel Discussion â€” Join Ladies Get Paid, TopResume and Glassdoor for a collaborative panel discussion covering salary trends, negotiation and employer POV of salary compÂ packages.
Hired

â™ŸÂ Shall we play a game?

Betafish: A Chess Engine and AI Move Finder â€” The author explains the algorithm used and thereâ€™s a playable versionÂ online if you fancy a 'nice game ofÂ chess.'

Gavin Ong

Or, if you prefer, you can build your own Tic Tac Toe game in just ten (quite meaty) lines of JavaScript..

items.title: Axios turns 1.0; TypeScript turns 10
items.content:
#â€‹609 â€” October 7, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web
Together withÂ 

JavaScript Weekly

Axios 1: The Long Standing HTTP Client Library â€” After eight years, 100,000 stars, and a presence in thousands of projects, Axios remains popular, yet v1.0 has only just landed (technically v1.1.2 now â€“ after some fixes and a a rather problematic change). The Fetch API has eaten into Axios' market in recent years but, a bit like jQuery, Axios still wraps up a lot of functionality into an API many developers like. (Project homepage.)

Axios Project

ğŸ¤” If you wonder why people use Axios when the Fetch API is widely supporters, interceptors are just one of many features its fans cite.

Free Course: The Last Algorithms Course You'llÂ Need â€” Over the course of nearly ten hours, this super fun free video courses dives into data structures, arrays, search and sort, recursion, graphs, trees and muchÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

'I Turned JS Into a Compiled Language (for Fun and Wasm)' â€” You can never be bored observing Surmaâ€™s work which continues to provoke ideas and discussion (such as with Web Workers). Now heâ€™s trying to run JavaScript in WebAssembly, which required turning JavaScript into C++ first. Eek! Good idea? Does it matter? Spoiler: â€œI think this technique is a dead endâ€ but it's a neat journey anyway and he explains how AssemblyScript suggests a more promising wayÂ forward.

Surma

ğŸ‚ Â Ten Years of TypeScript â€” Even if you donâ€™t use it, TypeScript's influence on the JS landscape is significant, and itâ€™s now ten years old. (It was our top feature in issue 99 along with the release of jQuery Mobile 1.2.0! ğŸ˜). TypeScript's PM reflects on how its ideas have stood the test of time and looks forward to another tenÂ years.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

ğŸ•¹ Â The js13kGames 2022 Winners â€” The eleventh annual js13kGames coding competition that challenges participants to create games in 13KB or less of JavaScript has wrapped up and here are the winners. If you have the time, thereâ€™s a lot to learn from the shared code, or you could just play the winning game â€“ a surprisingly slick 3D puzzlerÂ platformer.

Lee Reilly (GitHub)

The Future of the Web is on the Edge (Says Deno) â€” Deno is not merely an alternative server-side runtime for JavaScript â€“ it's at the heart of Deno Deploy, a serverless platform for taking JavaScript 'to the edge.' Andy sell us on the benefits of being edgy here while taking a potshot at north Virginia.

Andy Jiang (Deno)

IN BRIEF:

  • The latest VS Code update has arrived. JavaScript improvements include a new experimental API for customizing the rendering of JavaScript content in notebooks, and JS output in notebooks is now treated as a module meaning you can now use import inside such outputs.

  • What's the difference between 'undefined' and 'not defined' in JavaScript?

RELEASES:

  • Tabulator 5.4
    â†³ Interactive table/data grid control.

  • fast-copy 3.0
    â†³ A fast deep object copier.

  • Create Nuxt App 5.0
    â†³ Create a Nuxt.js app quickly.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

A (Mostly) Complete Guide to React Rendering Behavior â€” A classic article that's had a big 2022 update to React 18 standards. Dig into the details of rendering behavior and how Context and React-Redux affectÂ things.

Mark Erikson

'I Changed My Mind About Writing New JavaScript Frameworks' â€” Salma previously wrote about how you â€œprobably shouldnâ€™t write a new frameworkâ€, but sheâ€™s changed her mind â€“ maybe you..Â should?

Salma Alam-Naylor

How to Build URLs and Handle Redirects in Headless Architecture â€” Is your site getting larger, and URLs are getting out of hand? The chances are, your URL policy is notÂ future-proof.

Kontent.ai sponsor

â–¶Â Â Animating Triangles with Three.js â€” A 90-minute live coding session covering the creation of a striking whirlwind of triangles. You need to see it to get it, but I learn a lot from seeing how other people approach ideas likeÂ this.

Yuri Artiukh

â–¶Â Â Using npm query and jq to Dig Into Dependencies â€” npm 8.18.0 introduced the â€˜npm Dependency Selector Syntaxâ€™ and npm query to programmatically query a projectâ€™sÂ dependencies.

Elijah Manor

Increasing E2E Test Coverage from 10% to 95% in 12 weeks â€” A look into how Padlet achieved their product quality goals by offloading end-to-end testing onto QAÂ Wolf.

QAWOLF sponsor

How to Write CommonJS Exports That Can Be Name-Imported from ESM
Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

The New Test Framework Built-In to Node 18.8+ Explained
David Herron

Implementing Some of the Missing Math Methods in JavaScript
Olivia Gibson beginner

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Î¼Fuzzy: A Tiny, Efficient Fuzzy Search Library â€” A search library designed to match a relatively short search phrase (a figurative needle) against a large list of short-to-medium phrases (a figurative haystack) and to do so with low resourceÂ usage.

Leon Sorokin

zx 7.1: Google's Tool for Easier Shell Scripting â€” The idea is simple: use JavaScript instead of bash or Perl, say. zx smoothes off the rough edges (see the README for examples). v7.1 introduces an --install option to detect and install all imported packages in a script making it evenÂ easier.

Google

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Radix UI: Unstyled Accessible Components to Build on Top Of â€” Somehow weâ€™ve slept on Radix till now, but if you want to design your own components while still having a solid foundation to work from, Radix can take care of a lot of the rougherÂ edges.

WorkOS

Horizon UI: An Open Source Admin Template Atop Chakra UI â€” Includes a wide variety of dark/light components. GitHubÂ repo.

Horizon UI

SurveyJS: A Library for Making Survey Forms â€” A form builder library for creating data-driven, multi-langauge survey forms. It has a â€˜proâ€™ level and some related commercial services but is MIT licensed at theÂ base.

SurveyJS

âš¡ï¸ OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

  • eslint-plugin-vue 9.6
    â†³ Official ESLint plugin for Vue.js.

  • ow 1.1
    â†³ Chainable function argument validation.

  • PartyTown 0.7.1
    â†³ Move resource intensive scripts off the main thread.

  • bpmn-moddle 8.0
    â†³ Read and write BPMN 2.0 XML (used to notate business models).

  • Fastify 4.7 â€“ Fast Node.js web framework.

  • Chalk 5.1 â€“ Terminal string styling library.

  • âˆ¿ wavesurfer.js 6.3 â€“ Navigable audio waveforms.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Stickermule

Senior JavaScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) â€” Join the CKEditor team to develop an Open Source project used by millions of users around the world ğŸš€and realize your trueÂ potential.
CKEditor

Senior Frontend Engineer (EU Remote or Relocate to Berlin) â€” Weâ€™ve built a product thousands of people love (see Trustpilot if you donâ€™t believe us). We need your help with React &Â TypeScript.
Feather

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired
